Welcome to the Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter, Issue 620 for the week of February 23 - 29, 2020.

=== In this Issue ===

* Focal Fossa (to be 20.04 LTS) Feature Freeze
* Welcome New Members and Developers

* Hot in Support
* Lo``Co Events
* Mir 1.7.1 Release

=== General Community News ===

==== Focal Fossa (to be 20.04 LTS) Feature Freeze ====

Steve Langasek confirms Focal Fossa has entered feature freeze. As such, from this point the focus is on bug fixes, any additional features will require an exception. Steve points out that care is the concern for the content of the archive.

https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-devel-announce/2020-February/001273.html

==== Welcome New Members and Developers ====

* Developer Membership Board Election Results - https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-devel-announce/2020-February/001272.html

Congratulations to these contributors!

=== The Hub ===

==== Mir 1.7.1 Release ====

Alan Griffiths writes about the release of Mir 1.7.1, with links to the Mir PPAs, source tarball, along with a brief list of improvements, and a list of bugs fixed.

https://discourse.ubuntu.com/t/mir-1-7-1-release/14529

Amplifying info:
* Mir 1.7.1 Released With X11 Support Promoted Out Of "Experimental" Phase - https://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=Mir-1.7.1-Released

=== The Planet ===

==== Xubuntu 20.04 community wallpaper contest ====

We are invited to submit wallpapers for the Xubuntu 20.04 community wallpaper competition, with terms and guidelines provided by links. Submission deadline is March 13, 2020 with six entries being included in the Xubuntu 20.04 ISO. Plus, they will be available via package for users of other xubuntu versions.

https://xubuntu.org/news/xubuntu-20-04-community-wallpaper-contest/

=== Canonical News ===

* Canonical at the OSM-MR#8 Hackfest, Madrid - https://ubuntu.com/blog/2020/02/27/osm-mr8-hackfest/
* Canonical takes leadership role in security for ROS - https://ubuntu.com/blog/canonical-takes-leadership-role-in-security-for-ros
* Experimental feature: snap refresh awareness and update inhibition - https://ubuntu.com/blog/experimental-feature-snap-refresh-awareness-and-update-inhibition

=== In the Press ===

==== Ubuntu Touch Mobile OS Drops “8” From Its Desktop Environment Unity8 ====

Sarvottam Kumar writes that UBPorts, the company behind the Ubuntu Touch project, has announced the renaming of Unity 8; the name has changed to Lorimi. Developers will need to update to a new API before packaging apps, with many links for additional details provided.

https://fossbytes.com/ubuntu-touch-mobile-os-drops-8-from-its-desktop-environment-unity8/

=== In the Blogosphere ===

==== GIMP 2.10.18 Released With Many Improvements Before GIMP 3.0 ====

Michael Larabel reports the release of GIMP 2.10.18 with a new tool for performing transformations in a 3d space and other enhancements. We are reminded that GIMP 3.0 is still a while away, with link to the GIMP.org release announcement.

https://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=GIMP-2.10.18-Released

==== Ubuntu 20.04’s Default Wallpaper is Revealed… ====

Joey Sneddon tells us the new Ubuntu 20.04 LTS default wallpaper has been revealed. We get to see the image, along with Joey's thoughts on that design.

https://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2020/02/ubuntu-20-04-wallpaper-revealed

=== Get Involved ===

The Ubuntu community consists of individuals and teams, working on different aspects of the distribution, giving advice and technical support, and helping to promote Ubuntu to a wider audience. No contribution is too small, and anyone can help. It's your chance to get in on all the community fun associated with developing and promoting Ubuntu. More on this at: https://community.ubuntu.com/contribute/

Or get involved with the Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter team! We always need summary writers and editors, if you're interested, learn more at: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuWeeklyNewsletter/Join

=== Feedback ===

This document is maintained by the Ubuntu Weekly News Team. If you have a story idea or suggestions for the Weekly Newsletter, join the Ubuntu News Team mailing list at https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/Ubuntu-news-team and submit it. Ideas can also be added to the wiki at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuWeeklyNewsletter/Ideas. If you'd like to contribute to a future issue of the Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter, please feel free to edit the appropriate wiki page. If you have any technical support questions, please check https://community.ubuntu.com/help-information/ for more information on where to get help.
